question: In the figure, a conducting ring of certain resistance is falling towards a current carrying straight long conductor. The ring and conductor are in the same plane. Then the
images/e4d3c2b1-a1b2-4c3d-8e9f-000000000060.png
explanation: As the ring falls towards the wire, the magnetic flux through it increases.
According to Lenz's law, the induced current will generate a field to oppose this increase.
Assuming standard orientation (wire horizontal, current right), the field above is Out. Increasing Out flux induces Clockwise current to create In field.
